Description: Squat pottery stirrup jar, Furumark Shape 180. Handle restored with plaster. Painted with thick and thin brown bands.
Curator's comments: The NAA analysis is consistent with manufacture in Greece according to Leonard et al. 1993, Table 1. See also Karetsou Andreadaki-Vlasaki 2000, 259-60 no. 259b. Bibliography: Leonard, A., Hughes, M., Middleton, A., Schofield, L. (1993). 'The making of Aegean stirrup jars: Technique, tradition, and trade'. Annual of the British School at Athens 88: 105-123 Karetsou, A. & Andreadaki-Vlasaki, M. (2000). Kriti-Aigyptos: Politismikoi desmoi trion chilietion. Katalogos.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A989)
Furumark 1941 / The Mycenaean Pottery. Analysis and Classification. (FS 180:29)
